gaps_addressed:
UNCOMPLETED ROADMAP ITEMS for v1.0 (5):
  - All seed logic fully replaced by purpose-built modules
  - Self-iteration validated: Anima can improve its own modules reliably
  - Multiple AI agent backends (Claude Code, Codex, Gemini CLI)
  - Comprehensive documentation (generated from system's own specs)
  - Stable release on PyPI
agent_output_excerpt:
Iteration #35 complete. Summary of changes:

**Roadmap item completed:** Multiple AI agent backends (Claude Code, Codex, Gemini CLI)

**Files created:**
- `adapters/agents/codex.py` — `CodexAdapter` implementing `AgentPort` for OpenAI Codex CLI (`--full-auto --quiet`)
- `adapters/agents/gemini.py` — `GeminiAdapter` implementing `AgentPort` for Gemini CLI (`--sandbox=none -p`)
- `tests/test_agent_backends.py` — 18 tests covering both adapters + bridge agent selection + Protocol compliance

**Files modified:**
- `adapters/executor_bridge.py` — Dynamic agent selection via `ANIMA_AGENT` env var (default: `"claude"`, supports `"codex"`, `"gemini"`)
- `roadmap/v1.0.md` — Checked off "Multiple AI agent backends"

**Architecture:** All three adapters satisfy `AgentPort` via structural subtyping (PEP 544). The `executor_bridge` uses lazy `importlib` loading so only the selected backend is imported. Constructor injection is preserved — `Executor` remains backend-agnostic.

**Verification:** `ruf
